title: Deliver the morning papers to occupied rooms on Floor 1
The elevator is stuck between floors 1 and 2 again
Replace lobby flowers. Agnes knocked them over again.
Extra towels requested from the occupied rooms on Floor 1
An untagged suitcase was left in the stairwell. Handle it.
The dining room fireplace will not light. Reginald is displeased.
Arrange an early taxi for a guest checking out tomorrow
Confirm that Room 12 is actually empty. Management insists.
Replace the hallway bulb outside Room 7. Out again.
Retrieve and log breakfast trays from the occupied floors
Wind the lobby grandfather clock. It has stopped.
File a cold spot incident report. Staff reported the stairwell.
Polish the brass fixtures in the lobby. The state of them.
The boiler pressure is reading high. Investigate before it becomes a situation.
Restock the complimentary items on Floor 2. Someone took everything.
The lobby piano has a stuck key. Find someone to look at it.
A guest left a complaint note at the front desk. Acknowledge and file it.
The garden entrance gate is not latching. Fix it before dark.
Walk the property. Check each floor and report anything unusual to the front desk.
The ice machine on Floor 2 is making a noise. Investigate before guests notice.
Something was rearranged in the dining room overnight. Set it right before breakfast service.
A cold draft is coming from the stairwell on Floor 3. Find the source and log it.
Three lobby chairs have been moved into a circle facing the fireplace. No guests did this.
The kitchen inventory needs logging before the morning delivery arrives.
The front entrance mat is missing. Find it before the morning shift notices.
A window on Floor 2 has been found open. Close it and check the others.
The reading room books have been pulled from their shelves and stacked by the chair. Re-shelve them.
Maintenance found a door locked from the inside with no one in the room. Handle it.
The bar inventory has a discrepancy. Two bottles of bourbon unaccounted for.
Review the overnight incident log and initial anything unusual.
Review the quarterly incident reports and sign off as owner.
The linen supplier has sent another letter. As owner, you can finally settle it.
A journalist wants a statement about the hotel's history. As owner, this is your call.
Staff payroll needs your signature. Welcome to ownership.
A Portland preservation society wants to landmark the building. Respond as owner.
